definition: Meihua Quan - "Plum Blossom Fist" (Chinese Martial Art)
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: The basic training methods of Meihuaquan are simple and strong yet relaxed and highly adaptable.
sentences.chinese: 梅花拳的訓練過程簡便嚴格，又隨意自然。

sentences.english: During the uprising, the Plum Flower Boxers renamed themselves the “Righteous and Harmonious Fists”.
sentences.chinese: 在義和團運動中，梅花拳更名爲“義和拳”。

sentences.english: But locals reckon that Plum Flower Boxing could give them a boost.
sentences.chinese: 但當地人認爲，梅花拳能改善他們的境遇。

sentences.english: Meihuazhuang (can are traslate Plum Blossom Piles ) is a branch of Meihuaquan.
sentences.chinese: 梅花樁是梅花拳的一種。

definition: Tantui, a northern school of martial arts boxing
Ba Ji Quan "Eight Extremes Fist" - Martial Art
Paochui - "Three Emperor Cannon Punch" (Chinese Martial Art)
Baihequan (Fujian White Crane) martial art form
Ying Zhua Fan Zi Quan - "Eagle Claw" - Martial Art
Ba Fa Quan "Eight Methods" - Martial Art
Di Tang Quan - "Ground-Prone Fist"/"Ground Tumbling Boxing" - Martial Art
Hua Quan - "Flowery Fist? Magnificent Fist?" - Martial Art
